Grouped_Utterances: I'm glad you came in today. Can you tell me more about the ups and downs you've been experiencing? Well, I’ve had some good days where I feel motivated, but then there are days when I just feel really low and unmotivated again. That sounds challenging. What do you think triggers those low days? I think it’s mostly related to my job situation. I still haven’t found anything, and it just weighs on me sometimes. I felt good that I went, but I also felt a bit sad afterwards. Like, I should be doing more with my life. Yes, I guess I should focus on that more. It’s just hard to shake off the negative thoughts.
I’ve been thinking about my mom a lot lately. It’s been tough without her. Sure. She loved to paint, and I remember watching her create these beautiful landscapes. It always made me feel at peace.

Yes, I’ve been trying to push myself to get out more, but it’s hard. Some days I just want to stay in bed. I went to a local art exhibit last weekend. It was nice to be around art and people, but I felt a bit out of place.

I’ve tried some breathing exercises, but I don’t always remember to do them when I need to. That’s a good start! Perhaps we can work on a reminder system or a mindfulness practice that fits into your daily routine. Would you be open to that? Great! What if we set a specific time each day for a short mindfulness exercise? It could be as simple as five minutes of focused breathing.

I could try that. Maybe in the morning before I start my day? I think it could help me start the day with a clearer mind. I’ll give it a shot. Maybe I could try painting again. I haven’t done that in years. That sounds like a wonderful idea! Engaging in art could be a therapeutic outlet for you. How about we set a goal for you to paint something in the next week? Absolutely. I think it could be very healing. Let’s also explore how you feel after you paint in our next session.
